body.p:
Your welcome favor 10th ult ought to
have been answered ere this but in good ? I
never seem to get a moment from pressing business
of one kind or another. Let the past little contretemps
be past, I Probably took some part of your
remarks as addressed to or aimed at me, lest your
letter to our mutual friend revd. Gutheim dispel'd
all angry feelings on my part. Still friend
Leeser no matter in what humor you are in
you ought to vent your spleen rather on enemies
than friends, and I am sure if you were to
reperuse yours to me now you would say I had
a right to feel a little put out with you.

N'importe, let me see what I can tell you
that will interest you. Well we have had
the revd. Mr Eckman here and last night
elected him for the term of one year. He is
at present at Mobile where he had promised
to preach & he had some business to look into
there for a friend. O presume he will enter
on his duties on 1st. Feby. next when Mr.
Nathan's team ceases. Perhaps Mr. N
may give up in the mean time however.

I paid to Mr. Isaac Hart the subsn to Occident
for Mr. Touro & myself. Hart says he has written
you remitting my former payment to him.
I like the size of your new edition a sheet

of which you sent me. It looks, very well indeed.
You doubtless observed or heard of the conduct
of the Asmonean towards me & a few others
I really thank Mr Lyon for doing what
he did. It defined my position in opposition
to Dr. Wise's actions preachings & teachings
better than if I had written a volume
which they might have answered; but as
I took no notice of it whatever to several
strangers here stopped their paper in
consequence of what Lyon did, I have
had all the satisfaction I desired—
The subject of the Messiah is too important
and sacred to be touched by any but the purest
hands. They may talk about reforms as much
as they please & I have nothing to say. They may
try to do away with the 2nd days of the holy days &
still I will listen, but the main pillar on
which, in this Christian age we have to depend
to defend ourselves from the progress of unbelief
in our old plain & simple readings about
the messiah. Even the ressurection of
the body whether believed in or not does
not endanger our nationality. The Messiah
a temporal prince we never must yield—

As to reform in the Synagogue I defy any
improvement in that the service in ours here
The shule? is supported by subscription and we
consequently search, have any offerings now

The imprudence of men who would reform the practice
of reading the Law to 3 years is astonishing
They would do away with inspired writings to
give them more time to tire their hearers with
their comparatively inspired twaddle. Yes
this is what they want to do, as if any preaching
can do the good that the reading of the Bible
will. Just ponder on this proposition &
see its enormity.

There is quite a learned man here Dr.
Askenazi, I found him an agreeable acquain-
tance altho' in order to converse with him I
have to use 4 languages at one time. Still I
understand him well enough and he is rapidly
improving in the english.

My relatives here desire to be remembered to you
and often speak of you. Will you please
give my fond love to my dear Aunt and tell
her I look for her husband to morrow
or next day.

And now my dear friend hoping that you
may live to enjoy many happy days and
specially that our approaching festival of
Hanuca may come to you & us all in peace
